questions.question: Trauma affects intimacy primarily because:
options: Trauma survivors don't want relationships
Closeness can trigger survival responses learned from past danger
Trauma permanently prevents intimate connection
Trauma only affects physical intimacy, not emotional

questions.question: The foundation for intimacy after trauma is:
options: Pushing through discomfort quickly
Avoiding all triggering situations
Felt safety in the body and relationship
Forgetting about the past

questions.question: When a trauma survivor is triggered during intimacy, the most helpful response is:
options: Continue to show them there's nothing to fear
Stop, provide safety, and let them regulate
Avoid physical contact in the future
Analyze what went wrong immediately

questions.question: Rebuilding trust after trauma involves:
options: Grand gestures of love
Consistent, predictable, safe behavior over time
Promising to never hurt them
Proving the past won't happen again

questions.question: A partner supporting a trauma survivor should:
options: Fix their partner's trauma
Always put their own needs last
Provide support while maintaining their own boundaries and wellbeing
Avoid any topic related to the trauma
